results.title: The Colombo Plan
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A cartoon film on the Colombo Plan which links a number of countries throughout the world pledged to improve each other’s economic conditions. To increase prosperity and make the earth fruitful, technical knowledge and experience, equipment and funds, are essential before progress can be made. This cartoon shows how, in the past ten years, the people of Colombo Plan countries are benefitting from co-operation.

results.title: Colombia and Venezuela
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Four sub-regions are determined by the topography of these two South American countries; the climate, the industries, and the population of these are studied - farming, shipping, mining and agriculture - with stress on the contrast between cities and countryside. The different types of people and their work, and the world trading economy of these countries are simply represented with the aid of animation.

results.title: The Cologne sports college
results.brief_description: The Sports College in Cologne was founded in 1947. Its aim is to train sports teachers for schools and coaches for sports clubs. The Sports College in Cologne founded in 1947 gives instruction in all branches of sport, theory and practice, to teachers from primary and secondary schools, future physical education industries, youth leaders, local and overseas students. The college has a well-equipped research laboratory to study respiration and circulation during physical exertion and research into muscular fatigue. Coaches include ex-Olympic championing instructing students in athletic, weight training, swimming, gymnastics, javelin throwing.

results.title: Colloids (elementary principles)
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Among the examples of colloidal suspension studied in this film are: fog (liquid in gas); whipped cream (gas in liquid); clay and india ink (solid in liquid); smoke (solid in gas); and mayonaise (liquid in liquid). Failure to settle is explained by Brownian movement, protective films, and charges on particles. The Cottrell process of smoke precipitation concludes the film.

results.title: Colleges of Advanced Education
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Colleges of Advanced Education offer a practical alternative to University training in a number of technical and creative fields. This film examines the wide range of studies being undertaken in Colleges of Advanced Education, all over Australia.

results.title: Collection and preservation of evidence. Section I and II
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description: Instructional film portrays homicide investigation, including equipment necessary for the collection and preservation of evidence; examining details of collecting, marking, and preserving all evidence; photographic recording or sketching of the scene of the crime; evaluation of the evidence; questioning of suspects; and solution of the crime.

results.title: Colette
results.creator_credit: Yannick Bellon and Jacqueline Jacoupy Films
results.brief_description: Impressions of the life and times of Colette (1873-1954), French novelist, who probed deeply into the life of the senses and into human, particularly physical, relationships. Colette was born Sidonie Gabrielle Claudine Colette in Saint-Sauveur-en-Puisaye, Bourgogne. She collaborated with her first husband, writer Henri Gauthier-Villars on the four novels of the Claudine series (1900-1903), using his pen name (Willy); they were largely her work. Writing under the name Colette, she established her reputation as the leading woman novelist of France. She was also a journalist, critic and playwright. The film includes a short interview between Colette and Jean Creteau. Extracts from old feature films and newsreels afford glimpses of Colette when whe was a dancer in a Montmartre music hall. French language with English captions.

results.title: Cold-rodders
results.creator_credit: Claude Larue, Marc Beaudet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An amusing view of the machine that has taken the country by winter storm: the snowmobile, revving, raring, ready to go. What the motorboat was to the summer lake, this motorized sled now is to the snow-covered fields. This film shows it all - the pull of this sit-down sport, the eagerness of the trade to keep it booming, the daring rivalry of the racing crowd, and the bemused pleasure of the family outing.

results.title: Cold can kill
results.brief_description: Presents the dangers of hypothermia and demonstrates preventive measures. Covers hypothermia caused by immersion in cold water and exposure to wind and low temperatures.

results.title: Coelenterata
results.brief_description: This film should be sued in conjunction with the film “hydra coelenterata” shows the structure and behaviours of relation organisms, including examples of the colonial hydrozoan and of the large jellyfish belonging to the scyphozoa and of their alternate generation, the scyphistoma. The anthozoan are represented by anemones, sea-pens, etc and the ctenophora by the common comb-jelly, pleuro-brachia.
